roleset.name: (cause to) convert liquid to solid, convert liquid to solid via an electric current
roleset.note: COAGULATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'coagulate' based on internet usage examples, expansion via VN. VerbNet entry 45.4; comparison with 'ionize.' (from coagulate.01-v predicate notes)
ELECTROCOAGULATION-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to coagulate.01. Coagulate.01 is a member of Vncls other_cos-45.4. Framed by Katie. (from electrocoagulation.01-n)

role.descr: instrument or manner, if separate from arg 0

example.name: Intransitive
example.text: This stops the bleeding and the blood will then coagulate or thicken into a scab.

example.name: All Arguments
example.text: Mary-1 made delicious cheese; first *-1 coagulating the milk by letting it sit in a damp cave.
example.arg: by letting it sit in a damp cave

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: It forms gas rapidly and abundantly, is practically non-pathogenic, or pathogenic only in overwhelming doses, and is distinguished from bacillus Friedlander by its coagulation of milk.

example.name: goal for beneficiary
example.text: After I had my electrocoagulation of the cervix, I was in pain for hours.
